content.description: Same sit start as Wet Dreams, but then traverse right. The crux is a tricky cross followed by a reachy crimp, and then it's fun slapping up good holds to the top.
content.protection: Some back breaker boulders behind you, bring plenty of foam.
content.location: Same boulder as Wet Dreams, closer to Mussel Rock than Wedding Rock, right by the big ocean boulder with the 4th class splitter.

content.description: Beautiful metamorphic features. Sit start, slap up slopers to a big final throw, and top out isn't exactly a gimme.
content.location: Closer to Mussel Rock than Wedding Rock, very close to the giant boulder on the ocean with the 4th class splitter. Look for the metamorphic slopers.

content.description: Climb the blocky arete to and undercling, get high feet, then throw for the little prow at the top.  Top out either left or right. Fun and committing.
content.protection: Terrible landing. Plenty of pads and spotters.
content.location: On the same boulder as Beta Fish, between Wedding Rock and Mussel Rock, but closer to Wedding Rock. The north-east arete.

content.description: Climb through the juggy holds on the side of the trailside boulder that faces the ocean
content.location: It is on the opposite side of the boulder from the V3 that faces the trail

content.description: Start on a right-leaning layback under the overhang with a precarious left toe and bust to the arete.  Power your way up and top out on positive slopers.  This route has some of the smoothest rock I've ever climbed on
content.location: This is on a boulder that is right next to the established trail, close to but slightly farther from the coast than the rest of the bouldering.  This problem climbs out of the short overhang that faces the trail (east side of the boulder).

content.description: If you bring enough pads, this thing is super classic!!! Climb some easy jugs to a flaky jug eight feet left of Under Throw. Pull the bulge with the highest heel hook you've ever seen and creep onto a thank-God undercling. The top out is slightly technical and a bit spooky, but is really the icing on the cake! This was a project in the Patrick's Point book, after finishing cleaning and sending a new name felt fitting.
content.location: Just to the right of Tidal Fight, the V10-12 project in the middle of the north face of the Mussel Boulder

content.description: Climb the blunt northeast corner of the largest boulder on the beach. Start low with your feet on a rail, then make a series of hard compression moves up to a difficult throw. V1 top out.
content.location: On the north side of the first large boulder (with the little trail going up it), left side.

content.description: Fantastic! Start seated in the cave and pull into the undercling. Set your feet and stretch for the good crimp out left. After pulling the bulge, there are only two more holds (the last one being only a dime edge), so pay good attention to your feet and reach high for the finish! The landing is uneven, so some creative pad-work is needed to level it out. It would be five stars if the landing was a little easier to pad. The name came from the crayon graphitti at the base.
content.location: Right hand side of the "Bottomless Boulder" below the point on Mussel Rock.

content.description: Crux is moving off the sit start and onto the face. Surprisingly fun move. Looks chossy at a glance, but the key holds are all solid.
content.protection: Plenty of pads and spotters, top out would be a little bit committing for newer climbers.
content.location: North face of one of the bigger boulders, halfway but closer to Wedding Rock than Mussel Rock. Look for the shelf-like start hold.

content.description: Step off the separate boulder and pull on to the wall with the arête to your left and a long reach to an undercling pinch up to your right. Bump up the arête until you can move right to the undercling (crux). The finish is classic! The landing is flat, but you’ll want plenty of pads and a spotter.
content.location: North end of Mussel Beach below the overhanging point of Mussel Rock. The rock is north facing and easy to spot while you contour the base of Mussel Rock.

content.description: Jest left of the obvious Tidal Fight project is a big platform. Above the platform is a squat/stand start (V6) with a right hand pinch followed by a very difficult mantle where most people abandon ship. If you make it through the mantle, climb carefully to the easier, but highball finish. The sit start broke making it significantly harder and is V7/V7+
